website_summaries.verdict: A budget-priced pressure cooker of high quality and good durability. A great choice if you are looking for a low-cost model.
pros: Stainless steel construction provides increased durability and longevity
Feature set matches those of higher-priced cookers
cons: May be too heavy for delicate glass cooking surfaces, but that's a small price to pay for the value that you get

customer_reviews.title: Bad Bad quality...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than a month and bottom is apart and spill all over kitchen .. it was traumatic and very unsafe.. i was burned and lot of stressed...
customer_reviews.author: sh

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke after 6 months, not covered in Warranty
customer_reviews.text: The cookers' handle just broke loose when I was opening the lid, just 6 months after I purchased and I tried to claim warranty on this as it says the Manufacturer has 1 year warranty. When I called T-Fal on their 1-800 number, it took me a long time to get hold of their rep and she said that the warranty only covers the pot and not the handle and other parts. Its definitely sketchy practice when your warranty covers only POTS. I am going to go with Presto or someone where they have a 12 year warranty and clearly mention what they cover in it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashay

customer_reviews.title: Can't hit 15 PSI
customer_reviews.text: Setting #3 is supposed to hit 15 PSI. It vents at 12.8 PSI. Useless for my purposes. The T-Fal web site has no contact info for US (404 web error). Looked well made, but it's crap if you can't achieve the pressure you paid for. I'll be trying to return after 1st use, but I regret this purchase and the lost time and product associated with it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Beware:  High in Nickel
customer_reviews.text: I just found out that the components in this pot are high in Nickel which can easily leach into food. I've been using the pot regularly for making meat and bone broths. I've suddenly developed allergic symptoms that I've never had before and now know that high pressure cooking creates high glutamine, more so than slow cooking. I'll not use a pressure cooker again. Disappointed in the high nickel in this product (it fails the magnetic test). I fear I've been poisoning myself for months.
customer_reviews.author: Iris Island

customer_reviews.title: Garbage and no spare parts to fix!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan in November and the handle has totally broke. I don't know even know if there is warranty for this. I just want to change this part. If anyone has any information please let me know. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Adriano Marson

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Does not reach the right pressure. Evaporates to much water. I sent it back and got a replacement. The second was even worse! - I wanted to can with 10 psi. But it started to vent even before 7 and I only reached 9 psi. - I put in 1,5 gallon of water, not even 1 pint remained after 75 minutes of pressurecanning. It evaporated about 1 quart of water per 15 minutes. For me, no T-fal pressure canner anymore! I switch to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: It does not reach pressure !!
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive canner and it has never once reached the proper pressure weight!! I have canned for years and I have never experienced anything so awful!! I ended up buying a cheaper model like I’ve had in the past because this one simply WILL NOT REACH PRESSURE!!! DO NOT purchase .. and when I called the company no one was available due to covid even though the rest of the country is back at work .. they could answer calls from home like so many other companies adapted to!!! I wish I could get my money back but I purchased last year and never got a chance to use it till this summer ..
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: this is garbage, I still trying to return and had no ...
customer_reviews.text: This product never worked properly, I tried to call this company 6 times and they keep on hold for at least 45 minutes each time . Do not buy this , this is garbage, I still trying to return and had no luck so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Was unable to achieve 15psi required for canning. When I contacted the manufacturer they informed me "There is a known problem. Issue gauge can be off by 1or2psi." They then told me to"just extend the time and if be fine." I'm sorry, good safety is an EXACT science, not a try and see thing! Stick with a basic pressure cooker, they actually work.
customer_reviews.author: John Guarascio

customer_reviews.title: Defective T Fal pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.text: This pressure cooker like others failed to seal when heated. Lid closes and appears to be all set to operate correctly, but no. Cooker has been placed on 3 separate styles of burners in attempts to try anything to make it function. Very poor workmanship and quality control. Threw the box out long before I attempted to use it so now it sits in the basement wasting away. Total piece of crap like others have stated in their comments about the T Fal pressure cooker. Total waste of money. I don’t give any one star ratings and this one gets a big fat zero if you could do that.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Makes great rice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom to replace one that she purchased in Korea decades ago. She prefers pressure cookers to cook rice (she claims it has a better bite to it) so when her ancient one no longer functioned properly, I decided to purchase this for her based on all the positive reviews here. She was initially hesitant on this product however it ended up meeting and exceeding all her expectations. So much that she raved to several of her friends in her group whom many of them asked for the link and purchased one themselves. Now, where’s my commission, Amazon? ;)
customer_reviews.author: liz7435

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pressure cooker for years. Finally, broke down and got one and have been extremely happy with the T-fal Clipso Stainless Steel Pressure Cooker. Nothing bad to say about this one. It's easy to use, easy to clean, and incredibly durable. I use it at least once a week. Meals that once took hours to make, I can now do when I get home from work! Braised short ribs, pot roast, pulled pork, stews, and more! I've had the Clipso for over two months now and the more I use it, the more I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Young

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought around the first of April in anticipation of canning vegetables. Used for the first time today a steam pours from the lid like it has no seal. No pressure builds. And yes, we checked the seal before we started.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Love it... why did we wait so long to get this?
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been using this almost every day for a week now, we were hesitant to get a pressure cooker because of concerns about safety up until now. After using it a few time and seeing the one touch positive locking system along with other safety features, we're now finding every excuse under the sun to use it for cooking. Baby Back Ribs, Beef Stew, Japanese Beef Curry, French Onion Soup. It's only been a week, but wish we had gotten this years ago (and by years I mean decades.)
customer_reviews.author: Mark OS

customer_reviews.title: works well,but defective gauge
customer_reviews.text: works well so far had to take one star off because the pressure gauge is not accurate it always reads 2 pounds even when not in use. update-.july 24 2017 accidently ruined the gasket ( my fault) but when i went to amazon for a replacement they dont have them and when we contacted amazon we were told that they dont have them and gave us no further help what so ever!!!.......well now its been two weeks almost since i started looking for a replacement seal and even after contacting t-fal directly have not been able to locate a new one.. i would suggest if your looking for one of these kind of cookers, look to another brand of cookware!!!
customer_reviews.author: dave weaver

customer_reviews.title: The Best one Yet
customer_reviews.text: I have down sized from a family of 6 to 1 and I love my soups, boiled beef roast and other recipes. This is easy to use, the pressure is easy to release once it's done. I have been using pressure cookers for over twenty years and I was skeptical about buying a small one. This one is great, and its T-Fal, easy clean up and no sticking. I would recommend this pot to anyone. Very happy and the size is great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome canner!
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier to use than I expected! I have canned a ton of stuff with it. Do remember to add in cream of tartar or between 1 tbs to 3/4 cup of vinegar to the water though so that you don’t immediately stain the interior like I did. That took a little work to fix, but was totally my own error. I love that this comes with two racks so you can stack jars. This canner works great!
customer_reviews.author: Cat42

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pressure cooker. It is idiot-proof. My first attempt was carnitas. 45 minutes after it was up to pressure and they came out perfect - stirred to shred and poured through a strainer - awesome! It's like having a crockpot with a time travel mode. I made a great stew in 30 minutes. I've tossed 6 pounds of chicken breasts at a time covered with broth and 30 minutes to shredded or 17 to cooked through. Miracle appliance!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: I'm new to pressure cookers
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to pressure cookers. This unit had good reviews, and I've heard good things about pressure cooking in general, so I went for it. So far, so good. Of course, I nearly jumped out of my skin the first time I used the quick steam release! I've whipped up some rice pudding and a few batches of risotto. They came out perfect. The pot is easy to clean in the dishwasher. If there are any changes, I'll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: DGlo

customer_reviews.title: excellent cooker and love the safety pressure release!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my old Brazilian pressure cooker that my mom handed down to me. It was about time to upgrade. What I like most are the pressure safety features that my old one didn't have. I have never been afraid of using a pressure cooker, but since mine was so old, it sometimes crossed my mind to have one that actually has a safety mechanism! I have heard of these old ones blowing up in the kitchen (usually because of the cook's error, like filling it too much, or leaving it on the burner until the water dries all up...).
customer_reviews.author: H. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: I use this to make some nice dishes
customer_reviews.text: Quality piece, I prefer this over electronic pressure cookers. Just don't forget about it! Made lots of nice dishes that needed pressure cooking. It's easy to use, and it is a sturdy piece of equipment. Very reliable. Not the easiest to wash by hand, because of the components, but if you have a good dishwasher, it cleans pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Ho

customer_reviews.title: STRESSFREES STAINLESS POWERHOUSE COOKER
customer_reviews.text: I got this cooker for my daughter who lives in Jamaica WI so I personally won't be using it but my friend has one for a few yrs now and he loves it....excellent piece of a powerhouse easy to use beautiful stainless steel not heavy like led but like WELL MADE DURABLE heavy..... I love how easy the top locks and open love that its safe I love it and my daughter will too 100%reccommended absolutely love the two handles on either sides don't like one long handle sticking out
customer_reviews.author: Dezrine D

customer_reviews.title: The gauge is nice too. That way if you turn the heat ...
customer_reviews.text: THIS THING IS HUGE, but it does the job well. Just put some extra water in, because you do get steam escaping from the valve when it reaches pressure (this is supposed to happen; it keeps it from exploding). Once the steam starts coming out, that's your cue to lower the heat. The gauge is nice too. That way if you turn the heat too low, you can tell that the pressure is dropping before you want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Will Corley

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to try using a pressure cooker because I had heard it's so much better than a crock pot. It really is. This is a great starter pressure cooker. I ordered the 6 quart and that's perfect for two or three people. I've cooked a several of the recipes from pressurecookrecipes.com and they've all turned out pretty well. The pan seems well made, is easy to use, and cleans up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: The best pressure cooker so far.
customer_reviews.text: So far the best pressure cooker I ever own. It was a challenge in the beginning but once I use it often it was easy. The fear factor always make people not to use a pressure cooker, including myself but this one took the fear out of me. Although, I make sure not to cook with high heat but medium to low heat. The fact that is stainless steel makes me buy it, so I search for a stainless steel rice cooker from this company but they do not carry it.
customer_reviews.author: Lirios

customer_reviews.title: No problem here!! Best quality
customer_reviews.text: I just received my pressure cooker and it works great. I saw all the posts about this cooker where people could not hit the 15 psi mark. Immediately went to my kitchen filled the cooker half way with water, set it to position 3 and turned up the heat. In a few minutes the cooker was hitting the 15 psi mark. I think the problem some people may be having is that they are not filling this big big cooker well enough. This thing is massive and perhaps if you fill it only to 15% then maybe your kitchens gas out put can't keep up. Just a thought I might be wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pressure Cooker
customer_reviews.text: We use this once every so often mainly for canning wort for brewing beer. But I have used it for canning pickles and relish as well, and it works great. The ability to stack small jars is wonderful, but you cannot stack the 1qt mason jars.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Worst pressure canner on the market
customer_reviews.text: I could have died! I spent plenty of time researching this item before I bought it and honestly I felt comfortable with it. It stated it would work on my model stove and also gas. Well let's just sa that if I had not been watching it like a hawk that it would have been a horrible experience. It would have burnt down the house. Currenlty the canner is warped so bad that the bottom is round. Never again will I buy T-Fal products. I will stick with my trusted Presto
customer_reviews.author: jerry thomas

customer_reviews.title: almost a great canner
customer_reviews.text: The canner itself was OK and works well. However the pressure gauge is not what you see in the ad photo. It does not have one pound incremental hash marks as is common. Instead it has what look like cell phone bars (1 bar = 2 or 2 1/2 lb. ea?) and the numbers on the dial, 1 to 3, correspond with the 1 thru 3 settings on the pressure relief valve for 5, 10, and 15 pounds. Simple and it works but I'm old school and want to know exactly what going on, not if I'm in the "range". I guess. to me, it's the difference between an oil pressure gauge and the "idiot" light in cars.
customer_reviews.author: stephen watkins

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for the steam release.
customer_reviews.text: I have a much larger pressure cooker that I bought years ago that has a much better design for releasing steam. you push forward on the lever and it release the steam AWAY from you. This pot releases it straight up. The first time I attempted to do that - it blew soggy dirty steam out like a blast force. I had to put a towel over it to contain it so that I could flip the lever back to closed and wait for a natural steam release . It's an nice size pot, but I'm going to continue looking for one like my old 10qt that typically is too big for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: avatrx

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift for Mom.
customer_reviews.text: I have a different model Clipso pressure cooker. I love it. My mom used to use a pressure cooker all the time when I was young. Her old one was old and she stopped using it when it got difficult for her to open and close. I let her barrow mine and she loved it. It is so easy to open and close with one hand, even my mom of 82 and arthritis. It cleans up easy too. I love the thick heavy bottom, creates even heat distribution. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: it is built with great quality. It feels like the old T-fal from ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my parents. Even though it is made in China, it is built with great quality. It feels like the old T-fal from France.
customer_reviews.author: TheWise1

customer_reviews.title: Decent but imperfect
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and as intended. Wish it had were induction capable. Works best on coil eyes. Not as great on glass top and useless on induction. The pressure gauge and steam vent are not perfect, registering about 2 lb pressure off. (10 stops at 8 on dial)
customer_reviews.author: Evan L Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a super large pressure cooker for this money, look no further. Pros: Easy to use, large, and functional for the money. Cons: Poorly design seals and the pot permanently discolored after one use.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Produces flavorful dishes in a click
customer_reviews.text: after purchasing many expensive and inexpensive pressure cookers my other half decided we should get this because of the easy openING and closing. it honestly does make life a breeze having a pressure cooker that just closes in one click and opens in one Click. not only this it also makes my dishes taste so much better and more flavorful
customer_reviews.author: MomOfTwo

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!! Changed my mind an
customer_reviews.text: . This was my first time canning. So easy to use The gauges are so easy to read. I’ve done potatoes, yams, apples, baked beans and now I’m doing beef cubes. It comes with a basic instruction book. I’m hooked. In this pandemic I think that this is time well spent.
customer_reviews.author: David Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Only works on certain stove tops which was not listed in the item description that I saw. So put it outside on our grill. Well the lbs are not listed. It has 1 2 3 numbers. Nothing in the manual that says what these mean. The recipes in the manual tell you 1 2 3 but that does not help you if you are using a recipe not in the book. We had bought one for my daughter and one for us. Big disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Rolande Harris

customer_reviews.title: T-fal, canning and easy
customer_reviews.text: We used this to can carrots. Worked like a charm. We had an issue of the vent sticking to begin with but for someone just beginning and this was our first time 'canning' I think it did an awesome job and was easy. Easy would be the best way to describe it for canning. We used Ball pint jars 9 on the bottom and 9 up on top 18 total. All sealed and looked good. Good price and did the job - I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Safe Cooking  appliance
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this product recommend buy 100%, time will tell if its high quality. So far excellent. Easy to use for those of you afraid of pressure cooking. Saves so much time in cooking process and tenderizes meat under pressure. Pulled pork and Ropa Vieja
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: I use this at least once a week, easy to use and I am no longer afraid to use it. Just a note, make sure all parts are dismantled for cleaning and you don't have to worry, proper cleaning, making sure especially that the valve is open (the pinhole, use a toothpick)
customer_reviews.author: Glory Massey

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Induction Range.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well with our induction range cooktop. An added and welcome feature is that we have found that it is less prone to overheating and burning the food, probably because of better heat distribution. This is more a feature of the induction range but it still needs a good magnetic stainless steel pressure cooker to make the whole thing work. Don't misunderstand, you can still burn the contents but this combination does appear to be a lot more tolerant of the heat up process. Pressure seal and gage appear to work appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: Busyguy PA

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold pressure as expected
customer_reviews.text: This item locked as it should have, but was not effective to hold pressure. Returned the item and ordered another. I think this one may have been defective.
customer_reviews.author: Mari-TX

customer_reviews.title: A great investment for ant kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This was the best kitchen decision I have made in years. I have been able to cook so many things in minutes that would take hours in a crockpot. The seal is very strong and well designed and the metal is thick and stain resistant. I highly recommend this pressure cooker to anyone who wants to make cooking easier, quicker, and healthier.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Will look brand new for many years!!
customer_reviews.text: It has been many years since I have used a pressure cooker and it was such a delight to take this beauty out of the box. It is so pretty!!! It isn't cheap looking or cheap feeling and it works just like the old clunky ones I remember. The capacity is just perfect for my needs. I haven't bought a big pan like this for quite a few years but it seems to me the price was very reasonable. I will get years and years of use from this and when it gets passed down to my daughter so will she.
customer_reviews.author: Bydnmytime

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase. Make sure you follow the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit. It works perfectly. I have made several youtube videos on how to use it. Best purchase ever. I am not sure if other have followed instructions to the letter because it is not the same as other conventional cookers.
customer_reviews.author: tmartin

customer_reviews.title: Not induction suitable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the questions people answered about it being induction compatable. It is not ferrous metal so it will not work on my stove top. A magnetic doesn't stick and my stove top gives me an error message. It's probably a really good product and much lighter than older ones which is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Coppernoll

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give an accurate rating!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this several months ago but have not had time to try it. I finally got some time off of work and I cannot find my manual. I have been looking forever for the online manual. The T=fal website does not even list this item. This is very frustrating!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gina Ragazzini

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy, get another pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.text: Constantly leaks steam. Gauge is not accurate, just says 1,2,and 3 to represent 5 PSI at a time, but it's not accurate. You could be on a number, but not know where your PSI is. Nice Size, easy Lock, terrible product. Get a different pressure cooker, you'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle

customer_reviews.title: great product with good quality
customer_reviews.text: 6 months of use. so far awesome, for cooking any kinds of meat. meat is completely done and in a short while (20-40 minutes depending on the kind of meat). also it is really easy to clean and wash.
customer_reviews.author: Mina

customer_reviews.title: Plastic knob will break off.  Does not reach 15psi
customer_reviews.text: Purchased happy But....... Returned due to plastic control broke completely off. Please don't trust the plastic pressure value controller. It snapped right off and scared the crap out of me when in use. Snapped right off during cooking and made a violent hiss and shot the valve control right off. If they made that controller metal that would work. Also this does not get to 15psi. It hangs below 13-14 psi. Thats not cool. T-Fail
customer_reviews.author: Constante

customer_reviews.title: Great Pressure cooker!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wife absolutely love it. Been using it for months, and it still looks like new. Nice heavy quality feel. Bottom is super thick to hold heat better. Would highly recommend this pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Flemming

customer_reviews.title: Under Pressure
customer_reviews.text: If you follow the instructions you'll have success. This is durable, heavy pot, which is a great size for a number of things, and the pressure cooker top is easy to use. I made a rich chicken broth in 25 minutes with it. One suggestion, don't overfill the pot past the line about 2/3rds up. Even by a little bit. It really is the limit if you don't want any splatter when it's depressurizing!
customer_reviews.author: Michael W

customer_reviews.title: Buy This One
customer_reviews.text: In recent years I have owned two "automatic" pressure cookers that have not lasted very long. They were both electric, set and forget type cookers. The electronics eventually went out and to repair was out of the question. I replaced the last one with the T-Fal manual type cooker and couldn't be happier. Works like a dream, is easy to clean up and is exactly what I want in a pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Liggitt

customer_reviews.title: Great cooker, need more replacement parts for it.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this pressure cooker for about a year and 5 months, the pressure valve broke. Went to T-Fal to look for replacement part and no where to be found. Other than that a great pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Juan C guevara

customer_reviews.title: bought 3 in 1 year. all the handles broke
customer_reviews.text: This pot works well but is not properly manufactured. I bought 3 and all 3 handles broke each time almost causing severe burns. I am returning the third one.
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased
customer_reviews.text: This pressure cooker is great, cuts down on cooking time yet provides tender, savory roast; also works well cutting down cooking time for garden vegetables. Easy to use, easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: KLF

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Seems good. Had to order a 1500w hotplate because I didn't read that it wasn't meant for glass top stoves. Instruction book from tfal kinda jumps all over the place. Hard to follow for the first time using it.
customer_reviews.author: K Blank

customer_reviews.title: just remember it is easy and don't be a fraid of it
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it a 5 , however the instructions could have been clearer and more concise,. just remember it is easy and don't be a fraid of it, just turn it on high, when pressure steam starts turn down to medium heat and pout timer on, Loved the release valve, no waiting or putting under cold water, All i needed was which lever 1 or 2 for which foods and the cooking time. spent considerable time researching times/ food requirements
customer_reviews.author: Nancy BS

customer_reviews.title: It is so nice to be able to can more than 4 qts ...
customer_reviews.text: It is so nice to be able to can more than 4 qts at a time like my old one. Really, really love this.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: CRAP
customer_reviews.text: This product sucks. Don't waste your money!!! Bought this less than a year ago and at first it worked well. States it's dishwasher safe and now after only using it a handful of times it's not creating a seal. I have tried several attempts from tightening the screws to placing the seal in every way possible to make a good seal tight fit and nothing. Save yourself from the headache and make sure you get the warranty cause I'm now screwed out of a hundred bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Snell

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good product. I use it for sterilization, and I haven't had any problems so far, and I've had it for over a year. It's kind of small, but I knew that when I bought it. I would definitely recommend this product if you are looking to do small batches of canning.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda B.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This pressure cooker is amazing! I’ve used multiple times and the food comes out great. It took me some time to adjust to the knob on the top since I am used to the older fashions. This one is wide and shorter so unlike my other one it’s easier for me to use.
customer_reviews.author: HDP-915

customer_reviews.title: Cute, solid little beast.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great size for two people. Forget using a pressure cooker for making stock. It comes out cloudy and isn't as flavorful. But a pressure cooker is an absolute necessity for cooking beans (even when soaked and sprouted) and a big convenience for quick-braised meals. I don't use a pressure cooker enough to spend 100+ bucks. But for well under $100, I feel that this quality little pressure cooker was an investment that will relieve some of the pressure in the kitchen. Remember: if you're live in high elevation, you can boil beans for 6 hours without much happening, so a pressure cooker's good to have for mountain folk.
customer_reviews.author: Secret Santa

customer_reviews.title: Good price, great product.
customer_reviews.text: This Is a wonderful pressure canner, seal test and initializing were perfect. The only downside is the manual, anyone without experience is going to need to do a little research to understand it, but other than that, I LOVE THIS CANNER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Better canner with it
customer_reviews.text: Always been warned about pressure canners. It’s not safe, can be burned, etc. But I feel better now that I’ve used it. The instructions could be better with more detail particularly about the correct and incorrect water level in the canner. But I have to say, home made tomatoes juice is better than store bought. It’s beats hot water bath canning.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Not Efficient Pressure Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I hate to give bad reviews but need to help people make decision before buying. This pressure cooker really went overboard on the safety feature. Too many mechanisms that prevent from hazardous use and compromise too much on heating and pressurizing efficiency. It took way longer to get to 15 psi because pressure was leaking everywhere, and to keep at constant 15 psi it took twice as much energy if not more.
customer_reviews.author: Roy C.

customer_reviews.title: Looks beautiful.....NO Instructions!
customer_reviews.text: I expected to get a booklet with instructions and maybe a few recipes, but got nothing. I have had other pressure cookers in the past but not like this design. I had to get on the internet to search out an owners manual. Amazon cutting corners???
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!!!! I really do.
customer_reviews.text: Love this it's highly recommend this pot! Im going to buy more to have a set The pot is beyond useful high quality! When they are Say stupid review saying there steam coming out of the round deleted u didn't read the instructions bonehead . It's just supposed to lead a small percentage of steam from around the lid at a certain point it's a safety mechanism built in. Will get and hold staying at a certain pressure as a safety feature built-in it releases steam around the lid so it don't explode. At a Certain pressure. Point turns it off so it don't overpressure. But then it's your job to look after it come on!lol
customer_reviews.author: C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Although it passed the pre-use testing phase with water, ...
customer_reviews.text: Although it passed the pre-use testing phase with water, the pressure indicator failed to rise when I prepared my first meal. Resulting in burning/charring of the food to the bottom of the pot.
customer_reviews.author: O.W.

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Absolute nightmare I took the lid off when I got it and put some water in to clean it and I put the lid on fine but now it won't come off again. Its jammed shut and only opens half way and when I go to seal it fully again it makes a horrible mechanical sound that obviously means it broke before I could even use it. Do not buy this hunk of junk no matter what. Instructions are no help they just say if the lid is stuck wait for it to cool down. Thanks. I'll try that.
customer_reviews.author: Hafe

customer_reviews.title: Great product and the 6
customer_reviews.text: Great product and the 6.3 quart is the perfect size. Love the design and its very easy to use. Good price with Amazon. The instant pot glass lid sold on Amazon fits perfectly, giving you the ability to use pot for other cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: So far I have canned pork and beans, beans, potatoes and stew. The lids is easy to put in place, I have had not problems with it. I would buy a second one but I cannot find it on Amazon anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality kitchen tool if you grow your own vegetables and can them. Do t buy this if you are on a government watch list. Other than that, can all kids of things like tomatoe sauce and soup and stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Master

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. Dripped/leaked a bit in the beginning, but it basically stopped. Heavy and sturdy pot and lid, quality feeling components, a little tricky to get figured out for a first timer. Worked well.
customer_reviews.author: wally scott

customer_reviews.title: My New Baby
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cooker. Easy to open, easy to close and easy to clean. I have made Oxtails, Cal de ras pinto beans, pepper soup, steamed vegetables, homemade tamales and baked chicken & Turkey wings to name a few. With the chicken and t-wings I pressure cook in chicken broth for 10-15 (depending on quantity), season, add my fixings (garlic, onions, etc) and place in the over for remainder cook time. Cuts cook time way down. I use once to twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Bbutiful

customer_reviews.title: Crappiest piece of equipment....DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Basically this thing is a pile of crap! Worked so hard to make soup and it couldnt reach pressure .... thought it would be good for a starter, but CRAP! I read all the reviews and in the end blah! Returned it and got an all american
customer_reviews.author: tara vasquez

customer_reviews.title: This does not work with induction cooktops.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 5 stars because I want to be fair in the assessment. There were mixed comments/reviews that said it did or did not work on induction cooktops. I went ahead and took the chance. Just wanted to pass along the info that it indeed does NOT work on induction cooktops. Sounds like a awesome product otherwise. I even thought to pull out my portable electric cooktop, but the burner is too small. 😟
customer_reviews.author: Meredith D Archer

customer_reviews.title: Pressure Issues!!! Buy Presto Brand Instead!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't hit pressure of 15psi (13psi if you're lukcy). Also, it is a real pain to even get a good pressure seal. I spend 15 minutes trying to get a good seal before it even begins to climb in pressure. Recently just bought the 23 quart PC by Presto and it makes a seal like a champ every time! Do not waste your time and money, go get a Presto!
customer_reviews.author: Darren Kogut

customer_reviews.title: pressure is too low because of leakage
customer_reviews.text: The seal is not durable at all. When the food cooked inside is boiling, steam would leak from the lid edge and the handle. It is horrible. I have to move the pot away from the stove. It could not reach the ideal pressure for cooking at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Zhu

customer_reviews.title: Only works at sea level
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this unit if you are above sea level. Total waste of money and I missed my return window so now I’m SOL. You will have to choose between overprocessing or underprocrssing every recipe because the 5, 10, and 15 setting do not give enough control. If you do still need one I’ve got one that’s never been used haha
customer_reviews.author: Wahlgrenwoods Woods

customer_reviews.title: Use it carefully. If you have no experience get the electric one.
customer_reviews.text: Can be difficult to use, I would suggest to buy the electric one since it’s cheaper thank this one and will be easier & safer to use. This one gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: David Al

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Just opened box, and this gadget is wrong T-fal said it's got their name but not their product. Counterfeit?
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Bell

customer_reviews.title: Love this design with the 2 smaller handles on each ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this design with the 2 smaller handles on each side, how the lid locks onto the pot, and how easily the lid releases after the pressure drops. Cooks really well, comes with a nice instruction manual and love the recipe booklet that comes along with it. Really well made stove-top pressure cooker at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Bogey17

customer_reviews.title: Can't use it
customer_reviews.text: Looks well made, but we can't use it because we have a glass top stove. Have to wait until we can upgrade to gas.
customer_reviews.author: Mandeep Amar Singh

customer_reviews.title: excellent pressure canner
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this pressure canner. It has excellent safety features and works great!!!! The only thing I did not like about it was that I cannot use it on top of my ceramic flat top Burners. But I purchased a single gas burner which I used and it has worked wonderfully and give me more room on the top of my oven to do other things while I am canning.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah S. Cosper

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use pressure cocker.
customer_reviews.text: Manual easy to understand, which makes it easy to use product. Light and easy to wash. Good capacity to pressurize food.
customer_reviews.author: Letticia Williams

customer_reviews.title: Well thought-out and high quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely well-made product. I was super impressed when I got into it and very happy that I spent the extra bucks. It's just thoroughly well thought-out and very well made
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The product is great
customer_reviews.text: Shipping is awful, it was given to a house three doors away. Lucky for me I knew the man and he brought it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Pressure Cooker you can get.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pressure cooker we have used so far. I recommend it to anyone looking for a safe and easy to maintain and use pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.author: AMOUADA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It’s an excellent product, works perfect. Easy to use and easy to clean. Enough to cook a meal for 6 adults. We are using it 3-4 times a week and never had a problem. I do recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: crap
customer_reviews.text: leaking water every time i try it. return period is kinda short so i didnt get to return it, cause i was taking my time trying to figure out how to get it to work. and using sterility test strips since i bought it to have a cheaper version of an autoclave. so i wasted money. cannot return it, and it doesnt work properly. smh
customer_reviews.author: ana

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: We have had one of these before and the new model is even better. We wore the first one out but it gave us years of faithful service.
customer_reviews.author: art

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality pressure cooker. I use it to can meat and it works great! It's heavy duty and holds a big load. If you've never used a pressure cooker before, the instructions are clear and it's easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Marlena

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with instructions or the advertised recipes. Was most likely a already opened box.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Left marks on new stove/did not get to desired pressure.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a new stove last month and on this pressure cookers first use it left marks on the top I cannot get out with any cleaner. The marks are permanent. Also I set the cooker to cook at 15 psi but the pressure releases when I get to 13 psi so I cannot get it where I need it. Also it did not cook evenly at all the cooking distribution was not good.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Unable to reach 15 psi
customer_reviews.text: Can't hit 15psi. Tried two burners and the most it could get up to was 14psi. Overall it is a nice unit, if it wasn't for the pressure issue I would prefer this over the presto unit. If you need this for sterilizing or makeshift autoclave go for the presto one.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and reliable Cooking Pot.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is very safe to open and close and it also retains a hot steamy pot while the food ingredients are being cooked!
customer_reviews.author: LarryT

customer_reviews.title: PRESSURE
customer_reviews.text: WAITING FOR ANSWER ON PRESSURE PROBLEM. DOESN'T BUILD TO 15 PSI ON GUAGE AND PRESSURE RELEASES
customer_reviews.author: keith richards

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I made this year. Since I reverted back to good old fashion healthy cooking, which took up a day and sometimes 2 days for multiple meals for the entire week. That time has been reduced to 2-3 hours. The Tfal is a solid pressure cooker very well made and easy to use. I was so impressed by its performance that I actually got rid of some older pots in the cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Allegra

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pressure cooker. I have been using it for over a year and it has performed perfectly so far. I like having two smaller handles instead of a long handle, and it is large enough for anything that I am likely to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F.

product_meta.title: T-fal Pressure Cooker, Stainless Steel Cookware, Dishwasher Safe, 15-PSI Settings, 6.3-Quart, Silver, Model P25107
product_meta.description:
Style Name:6QT Pressure Cooker

T fal Pressure Cooker, Stainless Steel Cookware, Dishwasher Safe, 15 PSI Settings, 6.3 Quart, Silver, Model P25107. Prepare healthy, delicious meals faster with this easy to use T fal pressure cooker. Reducing cook times by up to 70 percent (compared to conventional cooking), the large 6.3 quart cooker efficiently cooks a wide range of home cooked meals like roasts, soups, stews, chili, and more. The system combines steam, heat, and pressure for speedy results—without the loss of valuable nutrients and flavor like with other cooking methods. The pressure cooker’s multi layer base distributes heat evenly and prevents warping, and it can be used on all types of cooktops, including induction. Even more, the pressure cooker offers durable PFOA free stainless steel construction for a sleek appearance, long lasting durability, and health conscious performance. A steam basket and stand are included for multi level cooking options, like meat on the bottom, delicate veggies on top. For ultimate speed and convenience, choose between two pressure settings (10 or 15 PSI). The pressure cooker offers a variety of safety features, including a pressure indicator, a variable steam release valve, an over pressure gasket release window, a secure locking mechanism to ensure risk free opening and closing, and a sturdy stay cool handle for a secure, comfortable grip. With the lid removed, the base can go in the dishwasher for hassle free cleanup. A useful addition to any busy kitchen, the T fal 6.3 quart stainless steel pressure cooker offers ultimate time saving convenience for healthy at home cooking.
feature_bullets: COOKS UP TO 70% FASTER - reduces cooking time while retaining valuable nutrients and flavor (compared to standard cooking methods).
TWO PRESSURE SETTINGS - choose between 10 and 15 PSI to cook various types of meals.
DURABLE STAINLESS STEEL CONSTRUCTION - ensures optimal cooking and long-lasting performance.
SECURE LOCKING MECHANISM - ensures risk-free opening and closing
INDUCTION COMPATIBLE - Suitable for all heat sources including induction
DISHWASHER SAFE - with the lid removed, the base can go in the dishwasher for hassle-free cleanup

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
